IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROMOTE THE BENEFIT,PLEASURE AND RECREATION OF ITS MEMBERS BY OWNING,CONDUCTING, OPERATING AND MANAGING A GOLF, COUNTRY AND SOCIAL CLUB.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROMOTE THE BENEFIT,PLEASURE AND RECREATION OF ITS MEMBERS BY OWNING,CONDUCTING, OPERATING AND MANAGING A GOLF, COUNTRY AND SOCIAL CLUB.
IRS990.Desc: PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES ARE ORGANIZED AND OPERATED FOR THE PLEASURE, RECREATION, AND SOCIAL BENEFIT OF ITS MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part X : FIN48 Footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Club is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 23701g of the California Revenue and Taxation Code. The Club is subject to the assessment of taxes on what is termed "unrelated business income." For the Club, this is generally defined as interest income from investments, rental income, and nonmember income from sources such as food, beverage, and golf revenues. The Club recognizes tax positions in the financial statements when it is more-likely-than-not the position will be sustained upon examination by the taxing authorities. As of April 30, 2022 and 2021, the Club had no uncertain tax positions that qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. As of April 30, 2022, the Club's tax returns are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service and the California Franchise Tax Board, generally for three (3) and four (4) years, respectively, after they are filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CLUB HAS EQUITY MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CLUB HAS EQUITY MEMBERS THAT ELECT THE GOVERNING BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PURSUANT TO THE CLUB'S BY-LAYS SIGNIFICANT TRANSACTIONS AFFECTING THE CLUB OPERATIONS OR MEMBERSHIP MUST BE VOTED ON BY THE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CPA\Tax Preparer reviewed the Form 990 with the Controller. The Club Controller provided the draft returns to the Treasurer who signed the applicable returns and reported to the Board of Directors that the Form 990 was reviewed. The Form 990 is available to Board members who would like a separate copy to review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS COMPENSATION INFORMATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES OF COMPARABLE CLUBS IN THE AREA AND PRESENTS COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR CONSIDERATION AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE SUCH DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
